dna.summary: DNA is a double-helical polymer of nucleotides (A,T,G,C) with antiparallel strands; replication is semi-conservative; transcription to RNA precedes translation to protein.
anchors: Watson & Crick (1953) Nature — structure of DNA
Alberts et al., Molecular Biology of the Cell (Garland Science)
Berg, Tymoczko, Stryer — Biochemistry (W. H. Freeman)
concepts: double helix; base pairing; major/minor groove

elements.summary: Chemical elements per IUPAC; periodic properties stem from electron configuration; standard atomic weights maintained by IUPAC/NIST.
anchors: IUPAC — Periodic Table & standard atomic weights
NIST — Physical Measurement Laboratory reference data
concepts: bonding types: ionic, covalent, metallic, van der Waals

physics.summary: Foundational classical + modern physics references used per topic.
anchors: Feynman, Leighton, Sands — The Feynman Lectures on Physics
Landau & Lifshitz — Course of Theoretical Physics
concepts: Stat mech: ensembles, partition function, thermodynamics links
